oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Highlander Fling, Vol. 6, No. 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Highlander Fling special issue on the Civil Rights Program. Photographs of activities, work, and workshops are included. The publication emphasizes that both poor white and poor minority farmers are in similar circumstances.

The Highlander Fling was the Highlander Folk School's newsletter. First published in December 1933, the Fling detailed activities and goings-on at Highlander was well as educational programs, articles from staff and participants, and calls to action.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); United States. President's Committee on Civil Rights; Farmers; Farmers Union (U.S.); Civil rights; Civil rights movements; Labor unions; Agriculture, Cooperative; Consumer cooperatives; Rural health; Race relations; Fieldwork; Labor union locals; Labor unions and education; African American coal miners; Discrimination
